info.title: POWER Daily API
info.description: The API allows daily data requests of POWER Analysis Ready Data (ARD).

get.description:
This endpoint returns a single point time series based Analysis Ready Data (ARD) response of solar and/or meteorological data derived from multiple NASA"s Earth Science Division (ESD) projects.

- This endpoint selects the closet location to the requested input latitude and longitude from the source projects grid.

parameters.name: start

schema.title: Start Time
schema.description: This is the start time for the data request formatted as YYYYMMDD.

parameters.description: This is the start time for the data request formatted as YYYYMMDD.

parameters.name: end

schema.title: End Time
schema.description: This is the end time for the data request formatted as YYYYMMDD.

parameters.description: This is the end time for the data request formatted as YYYYMMDD.

parameters.name: latitude

schema.title: Latitude Value
schema.description: This is the point latitude value.

parameters.description: This is the point latitude value.

parameters.name: longitude

schema.title: Longitude Value
schema.description: This is the point longitude value.

parameters.description: This is the point longitude value.

parameters.name: community

schema.title: User Community
schema.description: The user community to return units for.

parameters.description: The user community to return units for.

parameters.name: parameters

schema.title: Parameter Abbreviations
schema.description: A comma delimited list of the parameter abbreviations.

parameters.description: A comma delimited list of the parameter abbreviations.

parameters.name: format

schema.title: Format Abbreviation
schema.description: The response objects output format.

parameters.description: The response objects output format.

parameters.name: units

schema.title: Units Type
schema.description: The type of units, metric or imperial.

parameters.description: The type of units, metric or imperial.

parameters.name: user

schema.title: User Name
schema.description: A user name for identification purposes.

parameters.description: A user name for identification purposes.

parameters.name: header

schema.title: File Header
schema.description: To show or hide the header files of CSV and ASCII formats.

parameters.description: To show or hide the header files of CSV and ASCII formats.

parameters.name: time-standard

schema.title: Time Standard
schema.description: The time standard to return timestamps for.

parameters.description: The time standard to return timestamps for.

parameters.name: site-elevation

schema.title: Site Elevation
schema.description: The custom site elevation in meters to produce the corrected atmospheric pressure adjusted for elevation.

parameters.description: The custom site elevation in meters to produce the corrected atmospheric pressure adjusted for elevation.

parameters.name: wind-elevation

schema.title: Wind Elevation
schema.description: The custom wind elevation in meters to produce the wind speed adjusted for elevation.

parameters.description: The custom wind elevation in meters to produce the wind speed adjusted for elevation.

parameters.name: wind-surface

schema.title: Wind Surface Type
schema.description: The definable surface type to adjusted the wind speed.

parameters.description: The definable surface type to adjusted the wind speed.

header.title: NASA/POWER Source Native Resolution Daily Data

text/ascii.example:
-BEGIN HEADER- 
 NASA/POWER Source Native Resolution Daily Data 
 Dates (month/day/year): MM/DD/YYYY through MM/DD/YYYY 
 Location: Latitude  <value>   Longitude  <value>  
 Elevation from MERRA-2: Average for 0.5 x 0.625 degree lat/lon region = <value> meters 
 The value for missing source data that cannot be computed or is outside of the sources availability range: -999  
 Parameter(s):  
 NAME     SOURCE Short Description Text (Unit)  
 YEAR  MO  DY  NAME 
 -END HEADER- 
 YYYY  MM  DY  <value>

text/csv.example:
-BEGIN HEADER- 
 NASA/POWER Source Native Resolution Daily Data 
 Dates (month/day/year): MM/DD/YYYY through MM/DD/YYYY 
 Location: Latitude  <value>   Longitude  <value> 
 Elevation from MERRA-2: Average for 0.5 x 0.625 degree lat/lon region = <value> meters 
 The value for missing source data that cannot be computed or is outside of the sources availability range: -999 
 Parameter(s): 
 NAME     SOURCE Short Description Text (Unit) 
 YEAR,MO,DY,NAME 
 -END HEADER- 
 YYYY,MM,DY,<value>

example.header: The POWER Daily API failed to complete your request; please review the errors below and the POWER Docs (https://power.larc.nasa.gov/docs/).
messages: A list of messages of corrections needed for the API request to be valid.

example.header: The POWER Daily API failed to complete your request due to the submission of too many requests.
example.message: The POWER Daily API is unreachable due too many requests are being submitted. Please try again later. If the rate limiting persists, please email larc-power-project@mail.nasa.gov with the request URL and any other relevant information to determine an appropriate solution to obtain uninterrupted access.

example.header: The POWER Daily API failed to complete your request. A an unknown error has occurred please try again later. If the issue persists please email larc-power-project@mail.nasa.gov with the request URL and any other relevant information.
example.message: The POWER Daily API is unreachable due to an unknown error (Server Side Error).

example.header: The POWER Daily API failed to complete your request. A required backend service is unavailable at the current time please try again later. If the issue persists please email larc-power-project@mail.nasa.gov with the request URL and any other relevant information.
example.message: The name of the backend service that is unavailable.

get.description:
This endpoint returns a regional time series based Analysis Ready Data (ARD) response of solar and/or meteorological data derived from multiple NASA"s Earth Science Division (ESD) projects.

- This endpoint returns the regional data on the source provider's grid.

parameters.name: start

schema.title: Start Time
schema.description: This is the start time for the data request formatted as YYYYMMDD.

parameters.description: This is the start time for the data request formatted as YYYYMMDD.

parameters.name: end

schema.title: End Time
schema.description: This is the end time for the data request formatted as YYYYMMDD.

parameters.description: This is the end time for the data request formatted as YYYYMMDD.

parameters.name: latitude-min

schema.title: Minimum Latitude Value
schema.description: This is the region/'s minimum latitude value.

parameters.description: This is the region/'s minimum latitude value.

parameters.name: latitude-max

schema.title: Maximum Latitude Value
schema.description: This is the region/'s maximum latitude value.

parameters.description: This is the region/'s maximum latitude value.

parameters.name: longitude-min

schema.title: Minimum Latitude Value
schema.description: This is the region/'s minimum latitude value.

parameters.description: This is the region/'s minimum latitude value.

parameters.name: longitude-max

schema.title: Maximum Latitude Value
schema.description: This is the region/'s maximum latitude value.

parameters.description: This is the region/'s maximum latitude value.

schema.description: The user community to return units for.

get.description:
This endpoint returns configuration settings of the microservice.

- This includes the available data formats, time range, and more.

documentation.title: POWER Daily API
documentation.description: The API allows daily data requests of POWER Analysis Ready Data (ARD).

description.title: Description
description.description: A short description of the purpose of the API.

start.title: Start
start.description: The first date of data available.

end.title: End
end.description: The last date of data available.

ParameterSeries.title: ParameterSeries
ParameterSeries.description: Time-series data keyed by parameter name.

ParameterValues.title: ParameterValues
ParameterValues.description: A dictionary of date (YYYYMMDD) to value mappings.

Parameters.title: Parameters
Parameters.description: Parameter metadata keyed by parameter name.
